chineseMeaning: n. 热情；狂热；激情；灼热;  =ardour(英).;
examples: The difficulty and failure both didn't cool his ardor.
She displayed great ardor for art.

chineseMeaning: n. 隐语；暗语；暗号；行话;
examples: Slang is an active linguistic constituent of English, which has entered dominant culture from cant, jargon, and argot of different sub-cultures.
For, it must be stated to those who are ignorant of the case, that argot is both a literary phenomenon and a social result.

chineseMeaning: adj. 醒目的；引人注意的；有趣的;  动词arrest的现在分词形式.;
examples: This is one of the most arresting galaxy smash-up images to date.
Her aspect was fair and arresting.
When the houses were finished, they were effective and arresting.

chineseMeaning: adj. 温和的；不油腻的；引不起兴趣的；平淡无奇的;
examples: He said this with his face expanding in a bland smile.
As a result news coverage tends to be bland.
This will tend to produce either bland, have-a-nice-day standardisation of, more usually, various idiolects-private versions of the language---that work only in specific contexts.

chineseMeaning: adj. 对享乐感到厌倦的；无动于衷的；非常世故的;
adj. 明目张胆的；炫耀的；公然的；喧闹的;
examples: I have never encountered such blatant disregard for the Bill of Rights .
Our teacher is guilty of blatant favouritism.
You don't have to be blatant about it.

chineseMeaning: adj. 平民的；民众的；通俗的;
examples: I am referring to Languages such as Demotic Egyptian and Ionic Greek.

chineseMeaning: v. 诋毁；贬低；诬蔑;
examples: We must be fair competitors and must never denigrate other firms.

chineseMeaning: v. 谴责；告发；通告废除;
examples: The minister's action was denounced in the newspaper.
American trade policies have been denounced by some European governments.
They denounced him to the police as a criminal.
Somebody denounced him to the military police as a spy.

chineseMeaning: vt. 剥光；剥蚀;
examples: The elevation of crust can make rock gold deposit weather and denude and the level of the denudation depends on the scale of the elevation.

chineseMeaning: n. 疲劳；疲乏；劳务杂役; v. （使）疲劳; adj. 疲劳的;
examples: She hoped to sleep off her fatigue.
The aeroplane wing showed signs of metal fatigue.
He was beaten out with fatigue when he got home.

chineseMeaning: n. 吹毛求疵的人;
examples: The faultfinder will find faults even in paradise.

chineseMeaning: v. 使担忧；使慌乱；使为难或紧张;
adj. 帝国的；皇帝的；特大的；英制的; n. 皇帝；女皇；马车车顶；特大号;
examples: Imperial sovereignty rests on a mixed constitution.
There are many ways to get to the imperial Theater.
The Palace Museum is the imperial palace of ancient Chinese emperors.
Imperial gardens occupy large areas.
Uncle is well known for his imperial generosity.
The car's petrol tank holds 15 imperial gallons.
The imperial gallon was standardized legally throughout the British empire.

chineseMeaning: adj. 鲁莽的；无礼的；粗鲁的；离题的;
examples: The impertinent remarks teed the speaker off.
I've had enough of your impertinent words.
The impertinent boy put his tongue out at me.
This is a point impertinent to the argument.

chineseMeaning: adj. 不能渗透的；不为所动的;
n. 推理；推论;
v. 极力赞扬；说胡话；咆哮; n. 喧闹的宴会；极力赞扬；胡说；(货车等的)围栏板;
examples: It's quite a good film, but it's nothing to rave about.
The patient began to rave incoherently at the nurses.
When he was accused of stealing, he raved wildly against me.

chineseMeaning: adj. 有暴风雨的；剧烈的;
examples: Their ship was sailing dangerously in the tempestuous sea.
She burst into a tempestuous fit of anger.

chineseMeaning: adj. 抓紧的；坚决的；(记忆力)强的;
examples: He hold on to my arm with a tenacious grip.
The eagle seized its prey in a tenacious grip.
She is tenacious in defence of her rights.
He is tenacious of his opinions.

chineseMeaning: adj. 温柔的；脆弱的；敏感的；亲切的；嫩的；痛的; v. 提出；投标; n. 投标；照管人；补给船；煤水车;
examples: She is always tender and soft-spoken.
Love is a river that drowns the tender reed.
Don't mention his divorce---it's a very tender subject.
The nurse was very tender toward the sick children.
This stir-fried meat is very tender.
There are lots of tender blossoms in the garden.
Her bruised knee is still tender.
